title: Open source wins concessions in new EU cyber law
description:
The European Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) has undergone substantial revisions, bringing relief to the open-source community. Back in April, the Python Software Foundation (PSF) had expressed concerns about potential repercussions for CPython and PyPI if the initial form of CRA were to be enacted. The primary worry was that, in the course of providing open-source... Read more »

The post Open source wins concessions in new EU cyber law appeared first on Developer Tech News.
